0.Pros: It can be a lot of fun because it's fast-paced and different everyday. I also worked with a lot of amazing people. Free meals and employee discounts. Easy to be promoted if you're a hard worker.
0.Cons: Customers can treat you like garbage just because you're a fast food worker and scheduling can suck (I worked for McDonald's for 3 years and never had a set schedule). They also occasionally hire people who are lazy and stupid so you have to do twice the work.

1.Cons: managers constantly had personal feuds, and we would run out of food.

2.Pros: Some of the customers, free lunch and a income. Also the closeness of the staff
2.Cons: The day goes by to slow and I dont like how they speak to employees

3.Pros: Most of the people you work with is great.
3.Cons: Poor organization, poor pay, management that doesn't care.

4.Pros: Working with and meeting new people
4.Cons: Having to drive 45 minutes going and coming each day.

5.Pros: The benefits package is comprehensive, including discounts with hundreds of other companies, college and university tuition assistance, high-school degree completion programs, English language courses, etc.
5.Cons: Non-competitive pay, and my location refused any requests for my work schedule I had point blank. I worked only when they decided I would.

6.Pros: For a fast-food restaurant they pay weekly and I love it because most fast-food restaurants don't.
6.Cons: Some of the managers need to be more professional and not treat or talk to you any kind of way. Most of us are similar in age

8.Pros: I worked during high school and the pay was decent
8.Cons: I didn't like always smelling like grease

9.Cons: Not paid nearly your worth, the stress and weight on your shoulders as manager really takes a toll when you are making barely over minimum wage.
